text: hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum i know you've
been asking about what is the easiest
way to seed a pomegranate and i'm going
to show you the trick today it's not
only the easiest way but it's also super
fast when you're shopping for
pomegranates in the supermarket try to
pick fruits that are heavy for their
size that means that there's a lot of
juice in those wonderful seeds also look
for a deep purplish red colour
pomegranate and unblemished fruit now to
see the pomegranate all you have to do
is cut it around the perimeter crosswise
but don't cut all the way through the
fruit itself so kind of score it going
through the skin but being careful not
to cut into the seeds of the pomegranate
because that's where all the juice is
you don't want that to come out of the
fruit so i'm just gently scoring around
the outside and then with your hands
here you can pry the pomegranate open
just like this and note look at no juice
is coming out because we didn't cut
through those seeds and so now the
easiest way to get the seeds out of the
fruit is to use a spoon flip the
pomegranate over in your hand like this
and use the back of a spoon you can use
a wooden spoon you can use a metal spoon
and gently tap the back of the
pomegranate here and the seeds will just
fall out now you can rotate the
pomegranate in your hand or move the
spoon around the fruit making sure that
you get all of them out use a bowl
something that's deep and wide enough to
catch the seeds so in a matter of a few
seconds the pomegranate is completely
seated just pick out the little pieces
of membrane and there you're ready to
serve your pomegranate seeds up on top
of a delicious fruit salad you could
garnish a cocktail with pomegranate
seeds or you could just eat them as a
snack so there you have it
the easiest and fastest way to get the
pomegranate seeds out of a pomegranate
kitchen conundrum solved
you
